description: NY income tax baseline data sources and methodology

primarySources.name: IRS Statistics of Income (SOI) - Table 2, NY State
primarySources.description: Individual income tax returns by state and income bracket (TY2022). Primary source for filer counts and AGI.

primarySources.name: Citizens Budget Commission (CBC)
primarySources.description: Revenue concentration analysis. Key finding: $1M+ filers pay 44% of NYS PIT ($25.7B) and 40% of NYC PIT ($6.7B). NY's share of national millionaires fell from 12.7% to 8.7% (2010-2022).

primarySources.name: NYS Comptroller - Revenue Reports
primarySources.description: Annual financial reports. NYS PIT collections ~$58.5B (FY2023).

primarySources.name: Empire Center
primarySources.description: NY tax and migration analysis. NYC collects 40% of income tax from top 1%.

primarySources.name: Tax Foundation - Federal Income Tax Data (TY2022)
primarySources.description: National percentile thresholds for income tax concentration. Top 1% (â‰¥$663K) pays 40.4% of federal tax nationally.

methodology.filerCounts: Directly from IRS SOI Table 2 for New York State, TY2022. Total: 9,767,160 returns.
methodology.agiByBracket: Directly from IRS SOI. NY total AGI: $1,018.9B.
methodology.nysLiability: Estimated from effective NYS rates applied to IRS AGI, calibrated to NYS Comptroller total ~$58.5B. $1M+ bracket calibrated to CBC's 44% concentration finding.
methodology.nycLiability: Estimated similarly, calibrated to NYC IBO total ~$16.8B. $1M+ bracket calibrated to CBC's 40% concentration finding.
methodology.nycResidentShare: Estimated from Census ACS + IRS SOI. NYC is ~42% of state population, higher share at top incomes (up to ~60% for $25M+).
methodology.millionaireSubSplit: IRS SOI TY2022 reports $1M+ as a single bracket (69,780 returns, $267.9B AGI). Sub-split into $1M-$5M, $5M-$25M, $25M+ estimated from historical TY2019 SOI detail and proportional analysis.

revenueConcentration.source: CBC + IRS SOI TY2022 + Tax Foundation

knownLimitations: IRS SOI reports $1M+ as single bracket; sub-brackets are estimated
NYC resident share by bracket is estimated, not directly observed
Some high-income filers use pass-through structures; their income may appear differently
Joint vs single filer composition varies by bracket and affects effective rates
State tax liability by bracket is estimated (calibrated to known totals), not directly observed

keyFinding.description: NY's share of the nation's millionaires fell from 12.7% (2010) to 8.7% (2022). If NY had maintained its share, the state and city would collect an additional $13 billion per year in PIT revenue.

combinedTopRate.note: Highest combined state+local income tax rate in the nation
